str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Afterwards. From meta and epeita; thereafter.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
To inherit, obtain (possess) by inheritance, acquire. From kleronomos; to be an heir to.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To reject after testing (examination), disqualify. From apo and dokimazo; to disapprove, i.e. to repudiate.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
Although, though. From kai and per; and indeed, i.e. Nevertheless or notwithstanding.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To seek out, seek out after, require. From ek and zeteo; to search out, i.e.investigate, crave, demand, worship.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.
